channel.title: kernel on NO TITLE
channel.description: Recent content in kernel on NO TITLE

item.title: Japan Linux Conference 2010 Porting MeeGo to Android platforms 20101112
item.description: Text is only Japanese sorry. Check out this SlideShare Presentation:Japan Linux Conference 2010 Porting MeeGo to Android platforms 20101112View more presentations from Mitsutaka Amano.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 for NexusOne status part2 and how to work(Using microSD and No fastboot! You can also dualboot both of MeeGo and Android).
item.description: As you see, Here is about MeeGo 1.1 can boot on NexusOne from microSD via fastboot. Part1: http://blog.mitsutaka.org/2010/11/meego-11-for-nexusone-status-and-how-to.html As I referred at LinuxCon Japan, Next step is standalone boot. So it’s complete replacement. Android => MeeGo. BTW, The slide of LinuxCon Japan is the following. http://events.linuxfoundation.org/slides/2010/linuxcon_japan/linuxcon_jp2010_amano.pdf http://www.slideshare.net/mitsutaka/linuxcon-japan-2010-porting-meego-to-other-devices-20100927 Warning: APPLY THIS AT YOUR OWN RISK! I replaced boot.img the Android to MeeGo. But boot partition(/dev/mtdblock2) is too small. This block only can write data about 2.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 for NexusOne status and how to work(Using microSD and Boot vi fastboot).
item.description:
Updated on 20101107(kernel build, kickstart file, dialer screenshot, fdisk /dev/mmcblk0) Part2. Single boot: http://blog.mitsutaka.org/2010/11/meego-11-for-nexusone-status-part2-and.html As you know, MeeGo could be worked on the NexusOne. It was v1.1 development release that time. Then I tried if MeeGo 1.1 final release could work on it. Of course, It could be work. and We’ve made it more responsive to running.
1. Linux kernel zImage is loaded from PC via fastboot command.

item.title: LinuxCon Japan 2010 my summary and review
item.description: LinuxCon Japan is the premiere Linux conference in Asia. Attending many core open source developers, kernel hackers, administrators, users and so on. It’s an important opportunity for open source contributors. So this is my summary and review. About my session. It’s my first time presentation in English. Actually I had prepared three months. First, I’m not a native speaker. don’t speak English well. So it needed. Second, My presentation was a plan to port the MeeGo to a device.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 Development Release(1.0.90.1.20100831.1) for N900 status
item.description:
As you know, MeeGo 1.1 Development Release(Nightly build) has been released. I saved some log files on my N900 when it was booted by microSD. I used in the following files. meego-handset-armv7l-n900-nokia-proprietary-1.0.90.1.20100831.1-mmcblk0p.raw.bz2 meego-handset-armv7l-n900-nokia-proprietary-1.0.90.1.20100831.1-vmlinuz-2.6.35.3-5.2-n900 You can get this image from http://tablets-dev.nokia.com/meego-codedrop.php on which you need your N900 product ID. BTW, N900 image can display the Handset UX. Also rotation can be worked.
dmesg [    0.000000] Linux version 2.

item.title: Memo: dmesg and X.org.0.log on the MeeGo + Nexus One
item.description: MeeGo kernel was paniced on the N1. then I used android kernel was built by myself. X.Org doesn’t work yet. dmesg [    0.000000] Initializing cgroup subsys cpu [    0.000000] Linux version 2.6.29-droid-debian (dbrowne@TheBria) (gcc version 4.4.0 (GCC) ) #11 PREEMPT Mon Feb 8 01:02:44 EST 2010 [    0.000000] CPU: ARMv7 Processor [510f00f2] revision 2 (ARMv7), cr=10c5387f [    0.000000] CPU: VIPT nonaliasing data cache, VIVT ASID tagged instruction cache [    0.000000] Machine: mahimahi

item.title: MeeGo 1.0 for N900 status
item.description: As you know, MeeGo 1.0 has been released. Netbook has the User Experience then you can test that using image on your netbook. But N900 and IVI image has no UX. They seem to be development release in position :( I have a time now, so I output dmesg on my N900 when it was booted by microSD and temporaly boot of kernel. I used in the following files. meego-n900-open-armv7l-1.0.0.20100525.1-sda.raw.bz2 ( bzcat xxx.

item.title: First step, watching git repositories of the MeeGo project
item.description: Currently, MeeGo sources were managed by gitorious http://meego.gitorious.org/ It has already been published 44 git repositories in the following. (20100519) git://gitorious.org/qemu-maemo/qemu.git git://gitorious.org/qemu-maemo/gles-libs.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-openmax.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-dsp.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gstreamer.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-base.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-good.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-bad.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/dsp-tools.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-nokia-videosrc.git git://gitorious.org/tracker/tracker.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/bluez-packaging.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/obexd-packaging.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/maemo-bluez-compat.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/osso-gwobex.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/osso-obc.git git://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/openobex-packaging.git git://gitorious.org/meego-cellular/libcmtspeechdata.git git://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/refhashutils.git git://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/libcreds2.git git://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/dpkg.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/image-creator.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/spectacle.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/bootchart.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/madde.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/obs-project-config.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/kickstarter.git git://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/qt-creator.git git://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/abrt-netbook.git git://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/google-gadgets-meego.git git://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/eom.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/uxlaunch.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/fastinit.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/kernel-source.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/gconf-dbus.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/package-groups.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/meego-rpm-config.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/sreadahead.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/image-configurations.git git://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/image-tools.git git://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/libsynthesis.git git://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/syncevolution.git git://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/libsocialweb.git git://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/librest.git You can watch some updates with gitorious service.

item.title: About MeeGo, MeeGo Netbooks UX screenshots
item.description: As you know, MeeGo codes has been opened on the end of March. You can get ia32/arm RPMS/SRPMS now. http://repo.meego.com But currently User eXperience doesn’t published. MeeGo community promised to release at Stard of April. And then, The promise was carried out :-) But we can only boot up and see console screen. There were some opinion to this activity on MeeGo mailing list. For example, “User interface has not been released.

item.title: My crazy and funny desktop screenshot ;-)
item.description: My desktop was funny and crazy. So I took a screenshot. I use below apps. Host OS: MacOSX 10.6.2 Guest OS: Windows XP SP2 on VMWare Fusion 3.0.2 Running Apps:   Host OS:     About This Mac     Dropbox     GrowliTunes     InsomniaX     smcFanControl     Tweetie     Facebook Notifications     Timemachine(Currently not use)     iStat menu     Tunnelblick(OpenVPN frontend)     iTunes     Skype     Firefox     VMWare Fusion     X11.

item.title: snd-intel-hda.c
item.description: あるH/Wのサウンドコーデックが見えないのでkernelを追ってます。もしかするとH/Wの問題かもしれません。。。あるべき変数のビットがたっていないのH/Wの接続PIN位置がずれているように感じます。

item.title: なぜviからemacsへ変える決心を？
item.description: 会社の中にkernel hackerがいるのですが、ある日linuxの/procについていろいろ教えてもらっていました。その人のモニタを見ながらいろいろしていたのですが、emacsを使っていました。linuxkernelのソースコードを一緒に読んでいたのですが、バッファの使い方が非常に高速でびっくりしました。しかも自分向けにカスタマイズしたemacs(emacs本体)を使っているんだそうです。やはり次元の違う方でした。やろうと思えば何とかなるし、やはりemacsは機能が多いからですね。

item.title: Linuxでファイル暗号化
item.description: kernelの機能でdm-cryptというものがあります。ファイルシステムのファイル内を暗号化することができ、比較的簡単に使えます。ファイルタイプのファイルシステムの場合はloopbackデバイスを経由してやり取りすることになります。redhat系で代表的なのは以下のパッケージで利用することができます。cryptsetupcryptsetup-lukscryptsetup-luksはcryptsetupをより簡単に利用することができるパッケージです。とまぁこんな感じで久しぶりに技術ネタを書いてみました。。。

item.title: 開発環境と運用環境はやっぱり別?
item.description: 開発環境はMacbookでも十分に使えます。Linux kernelのコンパイルもそこまで遅く感じません。

item.title: ターミナルを卒業したい
item.description: ターミナルを使い続けて１年以上になりました。xterm, kterm, gnome-terminalなどいろいろ使ってみましたが、文字コードを使い分ける時があるのでgnome-terminalが一番使いやすいです。MacOSXではもちろん「ターミナル」です。ほとんどgnome-terminalとかわりませんが。しかし、kernelエンジニア(linux)の方々を診てみるとemacsだけで全て完結している方も多いです。半年くらい前ではemacsは単なるエディタだと思っていました。でも、メール、シェル、開発ツールなど必要なもの全てそろっています。少しずつこっちで全部できるようになろうと考えています。

item.title: 今年の目標
item.description: 今年の目標を列挙します。1. ruby on railsを使いこなす。2. linux kernel日々勉強。3. 英語日々勉強4. とあるコミュニティに参加5. 海外デビュー?などいろいろ。とにかくがんばります。毎日(付け)更新しますが、一つの記事としてはあまり長くありませんのでご了承ください。
